required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Validate the Questionnaire Called IDSIQ™ in Patients With Insomnia Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center, Single-arm, Open-label Study in Patients With Insomnia Disorder to Validate the Insomnia Daytime Symptoms and Impacts Questionnaire™ (IDSIQ™)

brief_summary.textblock: The main study objective is to assess the content validity and the psychometric characteristics of the Insomnia Daytime Symptoms and Impacts Questionnaire™ (IDSIQ™).

detailed_description.textblock:
Zolpidem will be used as an active intervention to assess the sensitivity to change of IDSIQ™ in patients suffering from insomnia disorder.
IDSIQ™ will be administered during the screening period (within 14 days before enrollment in the study) and the treatment period (from Day 1 to Day 14). End of study (phone call) will take place 30-37 days after the end-of-treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Content validity of the IDSIQ™: scoring of items into domains
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the screening period, i.e. within 14 days before Day 1
primary_outcome.description: Content validity will be based on the combination of qualitative and statistical methods in order to generate a scoring algorithm

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychometric validitiy of the IDSIQ™: Internal reliability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the screening period, i.e. within 14 days before Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Internal consistency reliability assesses the extent to which the items correlate which each other within their domain and it is evaluated by correlation scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychometric validitiy of the IDSIQ™: Test-retest reliability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the screening period, i.e. within 14 days before Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Test-retest reliability assesses the reproducibility of the domain scores during a specific time period of stable condition and it is evaluated by intraclass correlation coefficients

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychometric validitiy of the IDSIQ™: sensitivity to change
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the IDSIQ domain scores after 2 weeks of treatment with zolpidem compared to baseline (before zolpidem administration)

arm_group.description: Commercially available zolpidem (5 or 10 mg) will be administered orally once daily during the treatment period (Day 1 to Day 14) following prescribing information from each country participating in this study

intervention.description: Commercially available tablets of zolpidem (5 or 10 mg) for oral use
